intro: Acicarpha, commonly known as the spikeless grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the grass family Poaceae. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, where they have adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Acicarpha species are characterized by their slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. They produce small, spikelet-like inflorescences that are often difficult to distinguish from other grasses. Due to their resilience and low water requirements, Acicarpha plants are sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
